data.title: Sweet Clara and the freedom quilt
data.by_statement: by Deborah Hopkinson ; illustrated by James Ransome.

description.value: A young slave stitches a quilt with a map pattern which guides her to freedom in the North.

excerpts.text: After a night of soft rain there is a sweet smell of roses as my sister, Minnie, and I slip past Mama's door and out of the house down Charlotte Street.

data.title: Crossing Bok Chitto
data.by_statement: by Tim Tingle ; with illustrations by Jeanne Rorex Bridges.

subjects.name: Indians of North America -- Mississippi -- Fiction.

details.description: In the 1800s, a Choctaw girl becomes friends with a slave boy from a plantation across the great river, and when she learns that his family is in trouble, she helps them cross to freedom.
details.title: Crossing Bok Chitto
subjects: Indians of North America -- Mississippi -- Fiction.
details.by_statement: by Tim Tingle ; with illustrations by Jeanne Rorex Bridges.

data.title: My heart will not sit down
data.by_statement: by Mara Rockliff ; illustrations by Ann Tanksley

description.value: In 1931 Cameroon, young Kedi is upset to learn that children in her American teacher's village of New York are going hungry because of the Great Depression, and she asks her mother, neighbors, and even the headman for money to help. Includes historical notes.

details.full_title: My heart will not sit down
details.title: My heart will not sit down
details.by_statement: by Mara Rockliff ; illustrations by Ann Tanksley

description.value: Describes peace as making new friends, sharing a meal, feeling good about yourself, and more.
